result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas B. Kolk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before January 22, 2016 .  Provide DNA Sample.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas B. Kolk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas B. Kolk in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
$443.00 fine or costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Provide DNA Sample
30 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Commence on or before January 22, 2016 @ 7 PM
Paperwork handed in court.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Auth filed and approved.  Matter will likely resolve.  Request new Return date 3 weeks out.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas B. Kolk in court with attorney Peter Middleton o/b/o Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties still need to discuss offer.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 10-09-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 10-21-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas B. Kolk in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Just appointed.  Request new PTC/RD.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas B. Kolk in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify for PD.  Defendant has not yet applied however.  Court allows 2 week reset.  Court goes through right to an attorney.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas B. Kolk in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE wants more time to get counsel.  Court advises DE re: right to counsel and instructs him to go to PD's office today.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and paraphernalia unless defendant has valid Rx.

Pre-trial conference at 08-07-2015 09:15 am.
Return date at 08-18-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas B. Kolk appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $500 cash bond with conditions.  State gives criminal history.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Ties to community.  Employed.  No warrant history. Defendant has not yet applied for PD.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and paraphernalia unless defendant has a valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
